name: df-fo
params: class c0, class c1, class c2
body: |- wb(wfo(c0, c1, c2), wa(wfn(c0, c1), wceq(crn(c0), c2)))
comment: Define an onto function. Definition 6.15(4) of [TakeutiZaring] p. 27. We use their notation ("onto" under the arrow). For alternate definitions, see ~ dffo2 , ~ dffo3 , ~ dffo4 , and ~ dffo5 . An onto function is also called a "surjection" or a "surjective function", ` F : A -onto-> B ` can be read as " ` F ` is a surjection from ` A ` onto ` B ` ". Surjections are precisely the epimorphisms in the category ` SetCat ` of sets and set functions, see ~ setcepi . (Contributed by NM, 1-Aug-1994.)
